All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractEntity
The AbstractEntity is a basic implementation of MobileWorldObject.
AbstractItem
An AbstractItem represents any pick-up-able item in the game world which a Player can obtain.
AbstractMachine
Machines are interactable elements in the game world.
AbstractTileTemplate
Tiles are immobile, immutable squares on a map.
Area
An Area is a complete, playable world where a Player can explore.
AreaGenerator
The AreaGenerator is used to randomly create new Areas.
AreaJson
 
BasicColorTile
The BasicColorTile is my classic lazy tile design: a square with an outline.
Collidable
The Collidable interface should be implemented by classes which should support collision detection and reaction.
CollisionBox
A CollisionBox is used to share collision detection and reaction between rectangular things.
Command
 
CommandParser
 
ConsoleComponent
 
ConsoleFactory
 
ConsoleFrame
 
ConveyorBeltSegment
A ConveryorBeltSegment is a machine which will move AbstractEntities in a given direction, assuming it is powered.
Direction
might not need this
EntityControls
 
Exit
 
FileSelectorUtil
 
FileSystemLevelLoader
 
FlyweightMatrix<T>
The FlyweightMatrix class is used to store a 2D array of values while conserving space in memory.
GameFrame
This serves as the window for the application, and is managed by a PageController
GameMain
 
GearItem
The GearItem is an item which the Player can pick up, then place in their Area as a PlacedGearMachine.
GearMachine
A GearMachine is a machine which can serve as a repeater for power provided to it.
GearRoomGenerator
generates structures that can teach the player how gears and power work
GeneratesStructures
Classes with this interface can randomly generate structures.
Help
 
HomePage
This serves as the starting page for the GEARS sidescroller application.
Illuminating
denotes that an object can produce light
ImageTile
The ImageTile is a tile which renders an image, trimmed to fit on the tile.
Interactable
Implement this interface in a class to specify that something should happen when a Player interacts with the object.
Interpreter
 
InterpreterImpl
 
InvalidCommandException
 
InventoryListener
The InventoryListener is used to listen for changes to a Player's inventory, firing whenever they pick up or lost an AbstractItem.
ItemGenerator
The ItemGenerator is used to produce random items for randomly generated Areas.
JsonResourceType<T extends JsonSerializable>
 
JsonSerializable
 
LanternItem
a LanternItem can be picked up and provides light
LanternMachine
 
Level
A Level represents a grid of Areas where the Player can move around.
LevelGenerator
The LevelGenerator class is used to create random Levels.
LevelJson
 
LevelLoader
This defines the minimum required functionality for a class responsible for loading and saving levels Note that this is not required to save the player's progress within a level, just the level data itself
LevelLoadingException
this exception is thrown by LevelLoaders when they cannot load or save a Level
LevelMenuBar
 
LevelPage
The LevelPage class is used to render Levels, and allows the user to play the game.
LightGrid
The LightGrid is used to apply dynamic lighting to an Area
LightLevel
a LightLevel is used to encapsulate details about the world lighting system a light value of 0 is complete darkness, while a light value of 255 is the maximum brightness
MachineGenerator
The MachineGenerator is used to randomly generate machines for AreaGenerator.
MapBoundsReachedListener
The MapBoundsReachedListener is used to listen for when a MobileWorldObject passes the bounds of a TileMap.
Matrix<ElementType>
 
MobileWorldObject
The MobileWorldObject class adds support for changing the coordinates of an ObjectInWorld.
ObjectInWorldJson
 
OpenTileSearch
The OpenTileSearch class is used to store algorithms used to find valid coordinates in a TileMap.
OutOfBoundsEvent
An OutOfBoundsEvent is fired whenever a MobileWorldObject passes the bounds of a TileMap.
OutputWriter
 
Page
Page serves as the base class for the different views of the application.
PageController
this class is responsible for switching between the different pages in the application
PassageGenerator
generates random passages
PerlinNoiseGenerator
more or less derived from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlin_noise this works as a function for the AreaGenerator, but is too claustrophobic to use as a tile map
PlacedGearMachine
A PlacedGearMachine is simply a GearMachine a Player has placed via a GearItem.
PlacedLanternMachine
 
Player
A Player is an AbstractEntity which can pick up and use AbstractItems.
PlayerControls
 
PlayerInventoryMenu
 
PowerGrid
The PowerGrid is used by an Area to denote which tiles are being supplied electrical power, and which are not.
PowerPlant
A PowerPlant is simply a machine which provides power.
PowerProvidingMachine
Machines implementing the PowerProvidingMachine interface will provide power for other Machines.
RoomGenerator
generates random rooms
RotatedGearSprite
 
SpiralSearchAlgorithm<T>
 
Sprite
 
StreamReaderUtil
 
StreamWriterUtil
 
Structure
A Structure is currently simply a Matrix which gets inserted into a TileMap.
StructureGenerator
The StructureGenerator is used to randomly generate Structures for random Area generation, choosing from among structure types it is provided.
TempTestLevel
Previously used in HomePage to test out game features
TileGenerator
The TileGenerator class is used to create randomly colored BasicColorTiles.
TileJson
 
TileMap
A TileMap is used to store tiles in a two-dimensional matrix.
TileMapGenerator
Use this class to randomly generate tile maps.
TileMapJson
 
TriConsumer<T,U,V>
 
UnrotatedGearSprite
 
Where
 
WorldObject
The ObjectInWorld class represents an object physically present in an Area.
